newsitem.title: SWEDEN: U.S. consumer data pushes Swedish shares lower.
newsitem.headline: U.S. consumer data pushes Swedish shares lower.

text.p: Strong U.S. consumer confidence figures depressed Swedish shares on Tuesday.
The Stockholm bourse's general index ended 0.84 percent lower at 2,851.20 in turnover of 4.98 billion crowns.

"Prices fell further after the U.S. data were released but I don't think you should read too much into that," a trader said. "Cyclicals rebounded toward the end of the session and the bourse feels fairly strong despite the downturn today."
Insurer Skandia plummeted 17 crowns to 276 on profit taking after surging a total of 42 crowns in the past two sessions.
Profit taking also hit drugs major Astra, the most traded share, and telecoms group Ericsson, dealers said. Astra slid 3.50 crowns to 130.5 and Ericsson fell three to 274.5.
Engineer Atlas Copco slipped four to 219 crowns while automotive group Volvo ended flat at 214.
Swedbank bucked negative trends and rose two crowns to 148.
